custom.description: Choose this configuration if you have a custom configuration and need to modify all available platform settings.

system_type.description: Select the system that you will be using.  By default on most platforms will be the Raspberry Pi.  Select Prototype only if you are doing development testing.

standalone.description: Select if your are using PiFire alongside the OEM Controller.

triggerlevel.description: Select the trigger level for the relays on the platform.

dc_fan.description: Select if your platform supports a DC(PWM) fan or uses a regular AC Fan.

output_auger.description: Select the GPIO used for the Auger relay.

output_dc_fan.description: Select the GPIO used for the DC Fan.

output_fan.description: Select the GPIO used for enabling/disabling fan.

output_igniter.description: Select the GPIO used for the Igniter relay.

output_power.description: Select the GPIO used for the AC Power Gate.

output_pwm.description: Select the GPIO used for the DC Fan PWM.  Note that this should be a PWM capable GPIO.

input_selector.description: If the OEM controller is present alongside the PiFire controller, this GPIO will be used to select the active controller. Note that this will not be utilized unless 'Standalone' is set to False.  This should be set to 'None' if not utilized.

input_shutdown.description: GPIO Pin configured to shutdown the system.  Used for the wake/shutdown button on some designs.  Set this to 'None' if not utilized.

device_display_dc.description: GPIO Pin for the SPI Display DC Pin.

device_display_led.description: GPIO Pin for the SPI Display LED Backlight.

device_display_rst.description: GPIO Pin for the SPI Display Reset.

device_distance_echo.description: GPIO Pin for the HCSR04 Ultrasonic distance sensor ECHO

device_distance_trig.description: GPIO Pin for the HCSR04 Ultrasonic distance sensor Trigger

device_input_down_dt.description: GPIO Pin for Down Button / Encoder DT

device_input_enter_sw.description: GPIO Pin for Enter Button / Encoder SW

device_input_up_clk.description: GPIO Pin for Up Button / Encoder CLK

system_1wire.description: GPIO Pin for 1Wire bus/interface.  Used for DS18B20 sensors.

real_hw.description: Select Yes if running on real hardware (Default).  Select No if running in a test environment.

pcb_4.x.x.description: Default settings/configuration for the PiFire PCB v4.x.x modular PCB.  This PCB aims to provide modular options to the user for probe inputs and relay outputs.

ads1115_adafruit.description: This is the default module supporting ALL of the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC's and is based on Adafruit's Circuit Python implementation/module.  This version is still actively updated and may support a wider range of hardware.  There has been rumors of sellers shipping ADS1015 12-Bit ADC's instead of the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC's.  If you got one of these, you can try the ADS1015 Adafruit library instead.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

config.label: i2c_bus_addr
config.description: Select the I2C bus address to use for this device.  Default is 0x48.  If you have more than one ADS1115, you can assign unique device bus address for up to four devices.

config.label: ADC0_rd
config.description: Select the resistor divider value for this probe port.  Default is 10000 Ohm for temperature probes.

config.label: ADC1_rd
config.description: Select the resistor divider value for this probe port.  Default is 10000 Ohm for temperature probes.

config.label: ADC2_rd
config.description: Select the resistor divider value for this probe port.  Default is 10000 Ohm for temperature probes.

config.label: ADC3_rd
config.description: Select the resistor divider value for this probe port.  Default is 10000 Ohm for temperature probes.

config.label: voltage_ref
config.description: Select the voltage reference measured at the top of the resistor dividers (from the power supply source).  Default is 3.28V

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

ads1015_adafruit.description: This module supports the ADS1015 12-Bit ADC based on Adafruit's Circuit Python implementation/module.  This version can also be used with the ADS1115, as it is backward compatible.  Some fidelity may be lost due to the fact that the ADC has less bits to measure with, however in testing it seems to be reasonably good.  Use this if you are having issues with the default ADS1115 module.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

config.label: i2c_bus_addr
config.description: Select the I2C bus address to use for this device.  Default is 0x48.  If you have more than one ADS1115, you can assign unique device bus address for up to four devices.

config.label: ADC0_rd
config.description: Select the resistor divider value for this probe port.  Default is 10000 Ohm for temperature probes.

config.label: ADC1_rd

config.label: ADC3_rd
config.description: Select the resistor divider value for this probe port.  Default is 10000 Ohm for temperature probes.

config.label: voltage_ref
config.description: Select the voltage reference measured at the top of the resistor dividers (from the power supply source).  Default is 3.28V

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

max31865.description: This SPI device reads RTD style probes, such as the Traeger PT100(PT1000) RTD probe.  Note that special care may need to be taken if this is used with another SPI device (i.e. SPI Display) on the system.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

config.label: cs
config.description: SPI Chip Select (CS/CEx) pin used for this device.

config.label: rtd_nominal
config.description: RTD Nominal Resistance Value in Ohms. Default 1000 Ohms.

config.label: ref_resistor
config.description: Reference Resistor Value in Ohms. Default 4300 Ohms. (Typical options: 4300, 430)

config.label: wires
config.description: Number of RTD wires used for input.  Default 2

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

max31865_adafruit.description: This SPI device reads RTD style probes, such as the Traeger PT100(PT1000) RTD probe.  This version uses the Adafruit CircuitPython modules.  It should be noted that this module does not allow the use of CE0 or CE1, thus another GPIO should be used for the CS pin. Note that special care may need to be taken if this is used with another SPI device (i.e. SPI Display) on the system.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

config.label: cs
config.description: SPI Chip Select (CS/CEx) pin used for this device.

config.label: rtd_nominal
config.description: RTD Nominal Resistance Value in Ohms. Default 1000 Ohms.

config.label: ref_resistor
config.description: Reference Resistor Value in Ohms. Default 4300 Ohms. (Typical options: 4300, 430)

config.label: wires
config.description: Number of RTD wires used for input.  Default 2

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

mcp9600_adafruit.description: This I2C device reads K-Type thermocouples / probes. Moreover the MCP9600 can interface with just about any thermocouple type: K, J, T, N, S, E, B and R type are all supported.  This version uses the Adafruit CircuitPython modules.  Note that this device can be intolerant of higher i2c bus speeds, so you may need to reduce the i2c bus speed manually.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

config.label: i2c_bus_addr
config.description: Select the I2C bus address to use for this device.  Default is 0x67.  If you have more than one MCP9600, you can assign unique device bus address for up to five devices.

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

bt_ibbq.description: This device module supports Bluetooth LE iBBQ devices such as the Inkbird IBT-4XS four probe thermometer.  Note that the device can take up to a minute to be discovered and to start streaming data once turned on.  This has only been tested with the Inkbird IBT-4XS, but it may also work with other iBBQ models.  This module is still experimental, so feedback is welcome.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

config.label: hardware_id
config.description: This is the unique Hardware ID or Address of the peripheral (format: xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx).  This should be discovered during scanning.

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

bt_meater_exp.description: This device module supports Bluetooth LE Meater probe thermometer devices and is experimental. Not that this module relies on the simplepyble module and will not co-exist with other bluetooth modules based on bluepy.  This is not recommended for production use.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

config.label: hardware_id
config.description: This is the unique Hardware ID or Address of the peripheral (format: xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx).  This should be discovered during scanning.

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

bt_meater.description: This device module supports Bluetooth LE Meater probe thermometer devices (Original Meater and Meater Plus supported).  At this time the Meater Pro (Meater 2 Plus) devices are not supported.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

prototype.description: This is the test module for probe input.  It should only be used for testing & debug.

ads1115.description: WARNING: This module is no longer the default due to reports of issues.  If you experience trouble with this module, use the Adafruit modules.  This is an alternative PiFire module supporting the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC and should only be used if you are experiencing difficulty with the Adafruit module.

ds18b20.description: The DS18B20 digital thermometer provides Celsius temperature measurements over a 1-wire communication bus.  This module is currently experimental, but may be useful for calibrating probe profiles for other probes as itself has been factory calibrated.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

virtual_average.description: This is a virtual probe module that will average specific ports on real devices.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

config.label: probes_list
config.description: A list of probes from other devices, to average. Select which probes should be averaged together with ctrl+click.

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

virtual_highest.description: This is a virtual probe module that will return the highest value from specific ports on real devices.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

config.label: probes_list
config.description: A list of probes from other devices, to determine the highest value. Select which probes should used with ctrl+click.

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

virtual_lowest.description: This is a virtual probe module that will return the lowest value from specific ports on real devices.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

config.label: probes_list
config.description: A list of probes from other devices, to determine the lowest value. Select which probes should used with ctrl+click.

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

virtual_median.description: This is a virtual probe module that will return the median value from specific ports on real devices.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

config.label: probes_list
config.description: A list of probes from other devices, to determine the median value. Select which probes should used with ctrl+click.

config.label: transient
config.description: Select whether this device is fixed/always attached (default) or if it is transient/sometimes detached.

ili9341e.friendly_name: ILI9341 TFT with Rotary Encoder Input (standard)
ili9341e.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

ili9341em.friendly_name: ILI9341 TFT with Rotary Encoder Input (max31865 version)
ili9341em.description: NOTE: This version should be used if also using the max31865, due to SPI conflicts with the standard implementation.  The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

ili9341.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

ili9341b.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports a three button input.

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

ili9341f.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports a three button input.
ili9341f.notes: Pinout:  Display - MISO = MISO(Pin 21), LED = GPIO05, SCK = SCLK(Pin 23), MOSI = MOSI(Pin 19), DC = GPIO24, RST = GPIO25, CS = CE0(Pin 24). Buttons - UP = GPIO16, DOWN = GPIO20, ENTER = GPIO21, GND = GND, VCC = 3.3V

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured if equipped. This will be ignored if buttons are not selected as an input type. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).
Select the screen dimensions (width, height) in pixels. (default is 320x240)
List of input types supported.  Separate multiple types with a comma.

st7789_240x320b.description: The ST7789 is a 2inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341). This version of the module supports a three button input.

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

st7789_240x320e.friendly_name: ST7789 IPS Display 240x320px w/ Rotary Encoder Input
st7789_240x320e.description: The ST7789 is a 2inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341). This version supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

st7789_240x320.description: The ST7789 is a 2inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341).

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

st7789v_240x320.description: The ST7789V (V-Variant) is an LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341). This variant uses a forked library and should be considered experimental.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

st7789v_240x320e.description: The ST7789V (V-Variant) is an LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341). This variant uses a forked library and should be considered experimental.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

none.description: This is for systems without a display.  This module should be selected if no display is present.

prototype.description: This is the test module for display.  This should be used for development & debug only.

pygame_64x128.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

pygame_240x320.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

pygame_240x320b.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

ssd1306.description: These displays are small, only about 1" diagonal, but very readable due to the high contrast of an OLED display. This display is made of 128x64 individual white OLED pixels, each one is turned on or off by the controller chip.

ssd1306b.description: These displays are small, only about 1" diagonal, but very readable due to the high contrast of an OLED display. This display is made of 128x64 individual white OLED pixels, each one is turned on or off by the controller chip.

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

st7789e.friendly_name: ST7789 IPS Display 240x240 (using luma.lcd libraries) with Rotary Encoder Input (standard).
st7789e.description: The ST7789 is a 1.3inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x240px and is an affordable SPI display. This version of the module supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.
st7789e.notes: Pinout: Display - MISO = MISO(Pin 21), LED = GPIO05, SCK = SCLK(Pin 23), MOSI = MOSI(Pin 19), DC = GPIO24, RST = GPIO25, CS = CE0(Pin 24).  Encoder - CLK = GPIO16, DT = GPIO20, SW = GPIO21, GND = GND, VCC/+ = 3.3V

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle depending on your mounting position.

st7789p.description: The ST7789 is a 1.3inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x240px and is an affordable SPI display.  This one can be complicated to find the right compatible display, so your mileage may vary.  This module supports the 240x240 version and provides a simple color interface (similar to the SSD1306 OLED).  Try display module using luma.lcd libraries if this module results in a black screen.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).

dsi_800x480t.friendly_name: Raspberry Pi DSI Connected Display 800x480 w/Touch
dsi_800x480t.description: Raspberry Pi DSI Connected Display such as the 7" Raspberry Pi Touch Screen display. Several clones exist which should work perfectly well.
dsi_800x480t.notes: This module may take a very long time to install due to the OS dependencies that are required.  Please be aware that this may take more than 10 minutes to install depending on your system and internet connection.

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured if equipped. This will be ignored if buttons are not selected as an input type. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).
JSON file with all of the display data and information.
List of input types supported.  Separate multiple types with a comma.

protoflex.description: Prototype (Test) Flex Module for a with various input methods.
protoflex.notes: This module is used for development only and should not be used for production.

config.option_description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees).
Choose the screen resolution desired to select the corresponding JSON configuration file.
List of input types supported.  Separate multiple types with a comma.

hcsr04.description: This economical sensor provides 2cm to 400cm of non-contact measurement functionality with a ranging accuracy that can reach up to 3mm.

vl53l0x.friendly_name: VL53L0X Time of Flight Distance Sensor
vl53l0x.description: The VL53L0X is a new generation Time-of-Flight (ToF) laser-ranging module and is the hopper sensor of choice for the PiFire project.

prototype.description: This module should be chosen for testing & debug.

none.description: This module should be chosen if there is no distance sensor hardware installed.

name.description: This name will be displayed throughout the PiFire UI for this probe.  It should be unique to this probe and not match other probe names.

device_port.description: The device name and port where the temperature readings will be read from.

type.description:
Probe types are as follows:
Food - Used as a food probe to track the temperature of food items. This probe will be displayed in the UI and tracked in history.
Primary - Used as the primary probe to control the grill/smoker in hold mode, etc. There must be one Primary probe, and only one. This probe is displayed in the UI and tracked in the history.
Aux - Auxillary temperature input, not displayed in the UI, but tracked in the history. Used by virtual probes or for reference in tuning.

profile_id.description: The probe profile that will be applied to this probe (if applicable for the device).

enabled.description: Probe is enabled and visible in the UI.

pcb_2.00a.name: PiFire v2.00a
pcb_2.00a.description: Original PiFire PCB design with three usable probes exposed.

pcb_3.01a.name: PiFire v3.01a
pcb_3.01a.description: PiFire PCB variant designed by James Weber with all four probes exposed and a button header.

pcb_pwm.name: PiFire PWM
pcb_pwm.description: PiFire PWM board designed by James Weber with ADS1115 default.

pcb_4.x.x.name: PiFire v4.x.x
pcb_4.x.x.description: PiFire PCB v4.x.x with module design allowing for multiple types of probe devices to be attached.
